alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 6:17PM CST until February 18 at 7:15PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Brown County in northeastern Wisconsin... Kewaunee County in northeastern Wisconsin... Calumet County in east central Wisconsin... Winnebago County in east central Wisconsin... Southeastern Outagamie County in northeastern Wisconsin... Manitowoc County in east central Wisconsin... * Until 715 PM CST. * At 616 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Bellevue Town to near Northern Lake Winnebago to near Ripon, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 41 between mile markers 110 and 131, between mile markers 134 and 138, and between mile markers 140 and 171. U.S. Highway 41 between mile markers 172 and 179. U.S. Highway 10 between mile markers 285 and 286, and between mile markers 288 and 289. Wisconsin Highway 29 between mile markers 253 and 256. Interstate 43 between mile markers 137 and 163, and between mile markers 170 and 192. Wisconsin Highway 441 between mile markers 4 and 10. Locations impacted include... Green Bay, Appleton, Oshkosh, Manitowoc, Kewaunee, Bay Shore Park, Menasha, Kaukauna, Little Chute and Kimberly. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Winnebago
